paragraphs.body: Like the ${link_0} "protect the cultural heritage of Ba Sing Se", the Fanonbenders protect the quality of the ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Like the Dai Li "protect the cultural heritage of Ba Sing Se", the Fanonbenders protect the quality of the fanon portal.

paragraphs.body: The Fanonbenders user group is designed to keep the fanon portal at Avatar Wiki up-to-date and to improve its general quality as necessary. This includes, but is not limited to:
paragraphs.text: The Fanonbenders user group is designed to keep the fanon portal at Avatar Wiki up-to-date and to improve its general quality as necessary. This includes, but is not limited to:

paragraphs.body: Overall, Fanonbenders moderate and update the ${link_0} where normal users would not be permitted by the ${link_1}. This user group, however, holds no extra power or authority over any other users.
paragraphs.text: Overall, Fanonbenders moderate and update the fanon namespace where normal users would not be permitted by the fanon policy. This user group, however, holds no extra power or authority over any other users.

paragraphs.body: While this usergroup also targets ${link_0}, any user can constructively edit spelling, grammar, image sizes, coding errors, faulty templates and links, or anything else that needs to be improved within a fanon article. All users are encouraged to contribute to the fanon portal in this manner, as involvement creates an active, higher quality, and more positive community overall.
paragraphs.text: While this usergroup also targets low quality fanon articles, any user can constructively edit spelling, grammar, image sizes, coding errors, faulty templates and links, or anything else that needs to be improved within a fanon article. All users are encouraged to contribute to the fanon portal in this manner, as involvement creates an active, higher quality, and more positive community overall.

paragraphs.body: The Fanonbenders were originally created to combat the plethora of low-quality fanon articles circling around the portal Avatar Wiki in May 2011, after a proposal by Rassilon of Old in a forum thread. It was deemed a better approach than 'dumping' it into the targeted authors' userspace, which was the current protocol. In September 2012, however, it was decided that the Fanonbenders would look after all general updates in the portal as well, due to the widespread neglect of the Advertising System, archives, and Fanonbending achievements.
paragraphs.text: The Fanonbenders were originally created to combat the plethora of low-quality fanon articles circling around the portal Avatar Wiki in May 2011, after a proposal by Rassilon of Old in a forum thread. It was deemed a better approach than 'dumping' it into the targeted authors' userspace, which was the current protocol. In September 2012, however, it was decided that the Fanonbenders would look after all general updates in the portal as well, due to the widespread neglect of the Advertising System, archives, and Fanonbending achievements.

paragraphs.body: The Fanonbenders user group has several rules and guidelines that must be followed by all members;
paragraphs.text: The Fanonbenders user group has several rules and guidelines that must be followed by all members;

paragraphs.body: To ensure the success and organization of the Fanonbenders user group, well established fanon editors will be selected to help improve the fanon namespace's current quality.
paragraphs.text: To ensure the success and organization of the Fanonbenders user group, well established fanon editors will be selected to help improve the fanon namespace's current quality.

paragraphs.body: Please note that inactive members are still part of the Fanonbenders for a limited time.
paragraphs.text: Please note that inactive members are still part of the Fanonbenders for a limited time.

paragraphs.body: If you would like to join the Fanonbenders, please visit the membership requests page.
paragraphs.text: If you would like to join the Fanonbenders, please visit the membership requests page.

paragraphs.body: Every month, the fanonbenders run a fanon-writing competition. The idea, proposed by Omashu Rocks, is to get people writing, and provide small pieces of feedback for them. It is run from the first of the month, and goes for three weeks. The final week is for the fanonbenders to collaborate, and decide both a winner and the prompt for the next month.
paragraphs.text: Every month, the fanonbenders run a fanon-writing competition. The idea, proposed by Omashu Rocks, is to get people writing, and provide small pieces of feedback for them. It is run from the first of the month, and goes for three weeks. The final week is for the fanonbenders to collaborate, and decide both a winner and the prompt for the next month.

paragraphs.body: A list of the current fanonbenders and the pages they hope to help. Used as a way of sorting out who will tackle what when asked for help (see below).

paragraphs.body: If your fanon is in need of a little fixing up, just leave a request for help on the help page!
